When you look into the glazed eyes of a creature I've preserved, you see its struggle, its fear, its final breath captured forever. It's beautiful, in its own way. It makes people confront the reality they try to ignore.  They see the fragility of life, the power of nature, and maybe, just maybe, they feel a flicker of respect for the creatures they so easily dismiss.

They might recoil, sure. Some might even call me a monster. But isn't that the point? To shake them, to make them think, to force them to see the world through different eyes? My art isn't for the faint of heart. It's for those who crave something real, something visceral. It's a mirror reflecting the darkness that lies within us all. And maybe, just maybe, by staring into that darkness, we can learn to understand it, to control it, to become something better.
